elements.title: Maher Abbas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that future Olympic runner Maher Abbas (pictured) switched from basketball to track over his frustration of referees being "easy to bribe"?

elements.title: virtual unfolding (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that non-destructive virtual unfolding was used to read burned or otherwise highly damaged scrolls?

elements.title: Hongguang Emperor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Hongguang Emperor was betrayed by his troops and handed over to the enemy, who criticised his poor battle strategy and allowed locals to humiliate him?

elements.title: Pfizer Building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 2025 the Pfizer Building was cited as the largest office-to-residential building conversion in the United States?

elements.title: Jean Bonhomme (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that tenor Jean Bonhomme played for seven years on his university's Canadian football team before becoming an international opera star?

elements.title: Illinois Institute of Technology Academic Campus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Illinois Institute of Technology Academic Campus has been ranked as both one of the US's most significant architectural works and its least beautiful college campus?

elements.title: Lyubov Radchenko (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that, after proclaiming it was her duty as a revolutionary never to be "tied down by a family", Lyubov Radchenko got married and had a child?

elements.title: Nejishiki (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nejishiki was a manga with a following among the 1960s avant-garde movement?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

San Carlos de Bariloche

The Argentine adventure capital offers great opportunities for skiing, sightseeing, water sports, trekking and climbing amidst the amazing mountainous landscapes of Argentine Patagonia.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Sekigahara

This quaint mountain town and battlefield, where Tokugawa won control of Japan, gives visitors firsthand insight into feudal Japanese warfare.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

Driving in China

China isn't one of the countries that foreigners commonly explore by driving themselves. If you'd still like to, the first step would be getting a local driving licence.
